Misc¶

Helper functions, data structures, ...

Map and HashMap¶

A map/dictionary. Every object can be a key. Should be avoided whereever possible (use jQuery.data instead), because it may be slow.

The Map does no hashing, it stores key-value pairs in an array. The HashMap appends a _hashid property to each key or uses jQuery.data for DOM ``Element``s.

The HashMap has the same API as the Map, with one difference: The constructor of the HashMap has a boolean parameter which indicates whether the method each is needed or not.

class Map()¶

Create a new map.

Map.put(key, value)¶

Put an entry.

Arguments:
  • key (object) – The key.
  • value (object) – The value.
Map.get(key)¶

Get a value.

Arguments:
  • key (object) – The key.
Returns:

The value.
Map.remove(key)¶

Remove an entry.

Arguments:
  • key (object) – The key.
Map.each(callback)¶

Calls the callback function with each entry as parameter.

Arguments:
  • callback (function) – The function: fn(key,value)

helper functions¶

getFirstKeyInArray(data)¶

Deprecated Gets the first key of the given array. (Will be moved in future, too lazy until now.)

uniqueIds (jQuery Plugin)¶

jQuery.fn.uniqueId()¶

Generates a unique id for each element of the given jQuery object.
